commentary.text: Welcome back. AB de Villiers is doing all the talking in the RCB huddle. Shane Watson continues to stay away from opening the innings. Rahane and Nair walk out. Albie Morkel to bowl the first over
Morkel to Rahane,no run,on a length, some shape away, played with an open face to point
One wide slip in place
Morkel to Rahane,no run,no feet from Rahane as he goes after a shortish and widish delivery. Beaten
Morkel to Rahane,no run,shimmies down the wicket, Albie bangs this in shirt, gets good bounce, beats the edge again as Rahane pokes without conviction
Morkel to Rahane, $$FOUR$$ ,throws his arms at one, gets a meaty edge, over Gayle at wide slip
Morkel to Rahane,no run,full, on off, clipped to leg, but straight to midwicket
Morkel to Rahane,2 runs,on a length, angling in, nicely placed past square leg for a couple
Mitch Starc to bowl now
Starc to Nair,no run,short of a length, quick, straight, no room. Defended back to him
Starc to Nair,no run,slower ball, swings in a little, beats the inside edge, and also misses the off stump
Starc to Nair,1 run,swinging in towards middle and leg, gets a leading edge that doesn't carry to cover
Starc to Rahane,1 run,full, nearly a yorker, dug out for a single
Starc to Nair,no run,bouncer, middle and leg, he sways out and ducks under it
Starc to Nair,2 runs,on a length, middle and leg, clipped away for a couple
Andrew: "Starc's rhythm is absolutely beautiful to watch. It looks like he's barely jogging up to the wicket and then he arrows in those darts at 140kph+."
Morkel to Rahane, $$FOUR$$ ,short of a length, into the pads, with short fine leg up, that is asking for trouble. Pulled away as he stays deep in the crease to shorten the length
Morkel to Rahane,1 run,shortish, wide, the movement away hits the toe end of the bat for a single
Morkel to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,short again. Albie shouldn't be bowling short. Nair is deep in the crease, and pulls it for an easy four
Morkel to Nair,no run,elegant drive on the up, but can't beat point. He just leant into this drive
Morkel to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,Morkel goes short. Perhaps he has forgotten his name is Albie, not Morne. Pulled away for four past short fine again
Morkel to Nair,1 run,wide length ball, driven square on the off side for one
Ashok Dinda into the attack now
Dinda to Nair,1 run,length ball, middle and leg, uppishly towards midwicket, misfielded there
Dinda to Rahane,no run,on a length, swings away a touch, defended
Dinda to Rahane,1 wide,short of a length, but wide down the leg side
Dinda to Rahane,no run,short of a length, crunched away,  $$dropped$$  at Kohli at short cover-point. Harsh to call it a drop but it has gone straight to him

Dinda to Rahane,no run,Gayle dives at backward point to save runs, and the roof comes off at the ground as Gayle smiles. Something else in that shoulder might have come off too. He is walking off with an icepack on the shoulder
Dinda to Rahane,1 run,on a length, just outside off, pushed past cover for one
Dinda to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,that's unfortunate. Outswinger outside off, draws the inside edge, but it goes past the keeper for four
Manu: "3 of Yuvraj's last 4 half-centuries have come when Watson was part of the opposition team."
Varun Aaron to bowl now
Aaron to Rahane,1 run,on a length, middle and leg, worked to fine leg
Aaron to Nair,no run,short of a length, wide outside off, cut away to point
Aaron to Nair,1 leg bye,on a length, angling in, gets the inside edge onto the pad
Aaron to Rahane, $$FOUR$$ ,short, wide, Rahane upper-cuts it over point for four. This is a heartening start to the chase
Aaron to Rahane,1 run,fuller, on off, pushed wide of mid-on
Aaron to Nair,no run,on a length, on off, holds its line, driven to cover
Dinda to Rahane,1 run,length ball outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
Dinda to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,goes deep into the crease, gets under a length ball, and crashes it over cover for four. Nearly carries all the way
Dinda to Nair,1 run,another length ball, into the pads, clipped away to deep square leg for one
Dinda to Rahane,1 run,short of a length, into the pads, tucked away for one
Dinda to Nair,no run,full outside off, nearly a yorker, dug out back to him
Dinda to Nair,no run,full outside off, driven to mid-on
Time for timeout
Yuvraj Singh to bowl now
Yuvraj Singh to Rahane,1 run,flighted outside off, driven to long-off
Yuvraj Singh to Nair,1 run,slow, loopy, full outside off, pushed past cover-point for one
Yuvraj Singh to Rahane,1 run,on a length, outside off, no turn, defended past cover for another single
Yuvraj Singh to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,full outside off, he pulls out the slog sweep, and beats the deep midwicket. This chase is on
Yuvraj Singh to Nair,1 run,down the wicket, not close to the pitch of the ball, pushes it to deep cover for one
Yuvraj Singh to Rahane,1 run,full and straight, pushed to long-on for one
Chahal is on. The RR leggies had a good time
Chahal to Rahane, $$OUT$$ ,and Chahal is having it too. A wicket first ball. Skiddy legbreak, doesn't bounce much, Rahane goes to cut, gets a bottom edge, and PP latches on
Watson comes in at No. 3
Chahal to Watson,no run,short of a length, turning away, punched to short cover
Chahal to Watson,1 run,full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
Chahal to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,nice shot by Nair. Slightly short of a length, and he goes right back to manufacture his length, and cuts this past point
Chahal to Nair,1 run,mis-hits a length-ball legbreak, but the edge falls short of the advancing deep cover
Chahal to Watson,no run,punched off the back foot for a single
Yuvraj Singh to Nair,1 run,short of a length, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
Yuvraj Singh to Watson,no run,full, on off, pushed to cover

Yuvraj Singh to Watson, $$OUT$$ ,when it is your evening, it is often your night. Yuvraj pulls out a beauty. The arm ball. Watson is caught back to a length ball. It squeezes under the bat, and uproots the leg stump. Is MS Dhoni watching? Yuvraj the bowler has always been here even though the batsman has gone missing from time to time
Yuvraj Singh to Binny,1 run,slow, loopy, outside off, pushed past cover for one
Yuvraj Singh to Nair,1 run,full, on off, swept in front of square for one
Yuvraj Singh to Binny, $$OUT$$ ,Yuvi has got two wickets in one over. How can this night get any better? Stuart Binny, sent in to pinch-hit, dances down and gets a thick edge to deep cover
Chahal to Samson,no run,tossed up on middle and leg, defended back to him
Chahal to Samson,1 run,driven to long-off for one
Chahal to Nair,1 run,wrong'un, pushed from leg for a single
Chahal to Samson,no run,nice legbreak, dipping a little, defended back to him
Chahal to Samson,1 run,on a length, on off, driven to long-off
Chahal to Nair,2 runs,nicely tossed up outside of, driven to the right of deep cover
Yuvraj Singh to Samson, $$SIX$$ ,mis-hits it for a six. Down the pitch, toe-ends it, skies it, but manages to clear long-off. These boundaries are really small
Yuvraj Singh to Samson, $$FOUR$$ ,he is expecting the flatter shorter ball, sits back, rocks back too, and cuts it in front of point for four
Yuvraj Singh to Samson,1 run,tossed up on off, pushed to deep cover for one
Yuvraj Singh to Nair,2 runs,arm ball, into the pads, pushed in front of deep square, comes back for a second
Yuvraj Singh to Nair,1 run,stays back to a length ball, gets a single to long-on

Yuvraj Singh to Samson, $$OUT$$ ,long hop to make it three for Yuvi. tonight is a good good night for YS. Drags this down, but it stops a touch on him, and Samson is a little casual, and lobs this back to Yuvraj
Steve Smith is the new batsman in
Chahal to Nair,1 run,flat slog-sweep for a single to deep midwicket
Chahal to Smith,no run,down the wicket first up, beaten in the fight, gets a thick edge towards point
Chahal to Smith,1 run,shorter, cut away for a single

Chahal to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,down the wicket to reach the pitch of the ball and drive it straight of long-on. Both long-on and long-off go for it, Zol gets a knock on the head from AB. The ball is nowhere near. Definite red card for AB
Chahal to Nair,2 runs,hit wide of long-off for two
Chahal to Nair,1 run,a good field placement. Nair loves the slog sweep, and they have had that deep midwicket there to cut that boundary
Starc goes round the wicket
Starc to Nair,1 run,short of a length, outside off, cut away for a single. Bangalore boy Nair gets to fifty
Starc to Smith,1 run,short, angling in, pulled to midwicket

Starc to Nair,2 runs, $$dropped$$ $$at$$ $$extra$$ $$cover$$ . Stop the press. Yuvraj has finally done something wrong tonight. Flaw is the charm, I say. Slower ball, short, hit to extra cover, and Yuvraj lets a sitter slip through overhead
Starc to Nair,no run,quicker short ball now, beats him
Starc to Nair,no run,short of a length, runs his fingers across it, beats him as he tries to make room and run this fine on the off side
Starc to Nair, $$FOUR$$ ,desperate heave this time, but gets a healthy enough edge to have it fly over the leaping wicketkeeper, Patel
Yuvraj to bowl out
Yuvraj Singh to Smith, $$SIX$$ ,goes for six. That's almost like a right-hand Yuvraj hitting this shot. Just shimmies down and extends his arms through it. Clears long-off
Yuvraj Singh to Smith,1 run,driven to long-off for one

Yuvraj Singh to Nair, $$OUT$$ ,Yuvraj is on an absolute roll here. One of the best all-round performances of all time in T20 cricket? Nair dances down, misses a straight ball, and has his middle stump pegged back
James Faulkner. The last time he played in Bangalore, he scored the fastest ODI hundred for an Australian
Yuvraj Singh to Faulkner,no run,flat, short, pushed to cover
Yuvraj Singh to Faulkner,1 run,punched down to long-on for one
Yuvraj Singh to Smith,1 run,down the wicket, beaten in the flight, but he sticks his bat out in time, and denies Yuvraj a five-for
Aaron to Smith, $$FOUR$$ ,short of a length, Smith goes deep in the crease, and pulls this for four
Aaron to Smith, $$SIX$$ ,length ball outside off, he moves across to get inside the line and lofts it over midwicket for six. This match is not over yet
Aaron to Smith,no run,full, just outside off, beats his attempt to drive it down the ground
Aaron to Smith,no run,slower ball. Smith has not picked it at all. He is looking to go over the leg side, and then tries to poke at it at the last moment. Beaten
Aaron to Smith,no run,another slower ball, stays low, beats him outside off as Smith tries to go leg
Aaron to Smith, $$FOUR$$ ,Smith manufactures four out of nowhere. He moves all the way across and flicks this low and wide full toss past short fine leg for four
RR need 69 in the last five overs. They conceded 84 in their last five
Chahal to Faulkner,no run,lovely legbreak from Chahal. Beats the outside edge as Faulkner pushes at it outside off
Chahal to Faulkner,1 run,wrong'un, full, pushed to long-on for one
Chahal to Smith,1 run,wide legbreak, slog-swept to deep midwicket for one
Chahal to Faulkner,no run,tossed up on middle and leg, perfect legbreak, defended back to him
Chahal to Faulkner,1 run,short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
Chahal to Smith,1 run,nearly got him stumped, tossing the ball wide as Smith gives him the charge. Smith reaches out and gets bat on ball for a single to long-off
Time for timeout
Starc to bowl now. Really improbable that RCB will get it wrong now

Starc to Smith,1 run,full and wide, Smith gets under it, lofts it over point, gets a single to third man. Smith thinks he should take the second to keep strike, but then says no because there is no second available. Patel collects a wide throw and tries to flick it on, but misses
Starc to Faulkner,2 runs,now they come back for the second as Faulkner gets a thick edge towards third man. High throw from Zol and Faulkner makes it
Starc to Faulkner,1 wide,slower ball, but too far wide outside off. Called too
Starc to Faulkner, $$FOUR$$ ,wide length ball, he drives hard at it with an open face, and gets it over point for four
Goes round the wicket
Starc to Faulkner, $$FOUR$$ ,Faulkner goes for a desperate slog, gets a thick edge to a length ball, and beats third man to his left
Starc to Faulkner,1 wide,slower short ball, he has run his fingers on it, and the ball cuts away from the batsman to be ruled a wide
Starc to Faulkner, $$SIX$$ ,length ball, angling in, Faulkner swings it clean. This is not smart. Starc is getting rattled a bit here. Right into his swinging arc
Back over the wicket
Starc to Faulkner,2 runs,length ball outside off, Faulkner gets a thick edge as he looks to drive, and it falls safe between point and third man
Dinda comes back
Dinda to Smith, $$SIX$$ ,wide half-volley first up. That's a yorker gone wrong by inches. Smith shuffles across to reach it, and drills it over long-off for six
Dinda to Smith, $$FOUR$$ ,whipped away. This game is turning. The outfield is fast and small. Another half-volley, and he has smashed him wide of long-on. This is game firmly on

Dinda to Smith, $$FOUR$$ ,full and wide, Smith has done this intelligently. He has steered this with an open face, past point, and to the right of the diving third man. Aaron makes a desperate attempt but can't keep it in
Now it's RCB taking ages to set their fields
Dinda to Smith,1 run,moves across to a full ball, drives it to long-on for one
Dinda to Faulkner,1 run,wide length ball, Faulkner drives, gets a thick edge, the third man is fine, keeps them down to one
Dinda to Smith,(no ball)  $$SIX$$ ,this is a nightmare for Dinda. Everything that can go wrong has gone wrong. Huge no-ball, half-volley, smashed straight back over his head. This is incredible
Free hit coming up
Dinda to Smith,no run,wide yorker, Smith goes across to reach it, turns it into a half-volley staying back, drives it hard but can't beat extra cover. Dinda gets one back for the team
Twenty-one runs required off two overs. How this game has turned. Still tight. Two dot balls could put immense pressure on RR. Aaron to bowl. Have left the last over for Starc
Aaron to Faulkner,1 run,full and wide, driven to deep cover, gets just the single
Aaron to Smith,2 wides,two runs without a ball bowled. He has moved across, Aaron wants to go around him but bowl a full toss outside leg. They take the bye too as Patel dives and fields
Aaron to Faulkner, $$SIX$$ ,length ball, that's the worst he can do here. This has been smashed clear over wide long-on. Twenty20 making mockery of early finishes
Aaron to Faulkner,2 runs,slightly short of a length, hit wide of long-on, they come back for two
It is now taking an age to get this fourth ball bowled
Aaron to Faulkner, $$FOUR$$ ,and then he delivers a wide full toss. This game is gone. Again missing the yorker by inches, and he has crashed this past point for four

Aaron to Faulkner, $$SIX$$ ,they kept the last over for Starc, but he won't even get it now. High full toss on the pads, and he has flicked it over square leg for six. Kohli is gutted. Spare a thought for Yuvraj too. But it is the team with more Bangaloreans in it that has beaten the team that represents Bangalore

Stranger things have happened in cricket, but this match has to be right up.Govind sums it up here: "The Royals are becoming a specialist team in doing heists! They've won 3 games this year they had no business winning." Yuvraj Singh did all he could, but the RCB bowlers melted down worse than the RR ones did on this small and quick outfield in the face of heavy bats and fearless innovative batsmen. RR are now clear of that cluster in the middle of the table. The poignant memory of the match will be Yuvraj Singh walking back dejected. It is a cruel sport, is cricket. This is Sidharth Monga signing off. Good luck and good night

"I don't know about bowling, the last two time I have played here I have been smacked all over the place," says  $$James$$ $$Faulkner$$ , the Man of the Match. "In all seriousness, I thought AB was going to hit me for six sixes. It was very tough. We needed a fair few runs. I thought Steven batted really well in the 18th over to give us a lot of momentum, and the rest is history."

"We have always got belief, especially with batting we have got," says  $$Shane$$ $$Watson$$ . "We always knew we were ahead of RCB's run rate at every stage, and we knew we would have to pull something like their last five overs. And Steve and James were incredible in the end. Big win, especially where we were positioned in the game after the way they batted."
chibi: "Royals showed that team work with 3-4 performers wins games than one person from RCB performing for the team every match !! "
Siddhesh: "Yuvi still deserves the MOM. Its not his fault that his team had bowlers playing for Rajasthan. He did all he could and more."

"Just not able to hit the yorkers in the end," says  $$Virat$$ $$Kolhi$$ . "Sixty-four in four overs, you don't get nine times out of 10. Brilliant batting from them, but we should hit our yorkers. I told the guys, be on the button, this is a fast scoring ground, and the game is far from over when you think it is over."

"Went to have a shower, came back, RR have won! What on earth happened in 15 mins???" Amila, 65 runs scored off the last 17 legal balls. That is what happened. Yuvraj scored 83 off 38, took four wickets, and still ended up on the losing side. That is what happened. Between them, Faulkner and Smith scored 89 off 38. That is what happened. Crazy crazy game

name: Royal Challengers Bangalore v Rajasthan Royals
